error.signature: TS2456: Type alias 'X' circularly references itself

verdict.summary: A type alias references itself directly or through a chain. Use interfaces for recursive types or break the cycle.

dead_ends.action: Use any to break the circular reference
dead_ends.why_fails: Loses all type safety at the recursion point, defeating the purpose of TypeScript

workarounds.action: Use an interface instead of a type alias for recursive types
Break the cycle with an intermediate interface

leads_to.condition: When circular types cause infinite type expansion

preceded_by.condition: When conditional types create unintentional cycles

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Circular reference is a direct self-reference; excessive stack depth is the compiler running out of recursion depth
